NAME.Nominative: Transfer of the Relics of the Priest-Martyr Phokas

LIFE.Copyright: The Clergyman's Handbook. Moscow. 1978. English translation Copyright 1997 Fr. S. Janos.

SAINT.LIFE: The Transfer of the Relics of the Priest-Martyr Phokas from Sinope to Constantinople occurred on 22 July in either the year 403 or 404. The account about him is located under 22 September.
SAINT.TROPARION: As thou didst share in the ways of the apostles/ and didst occupy their throne,/ thou didst find thine activity to be a passage to divine vision,/ O divinely inspired one./ Wherefore, ordering the word of truth,/ thou didst suffer for the Faith even to the shedding of thy blood.// O hieromartyr Phocas, entreat Christ God, that our souls be saved.
SAINT.KONTAKION: Offering up sacrifices as a high priest, O father,/ in the end thou didst offer thyself as a living sacrifice,/ bearing witness lawfully to Christ God,/ accepting death and strengthened by angels,/ who cried out to thee:// Come with us, O Phocas, and no-one will be against us!
